content: What is this CMS camp thing you keep talking about?
Drupaldelphia is rebranding this year as cmsphilly - https://cmsphilly.org/ and going virtual.
@oadaeh (Jason Flatt) - We're thinking about how we might be involved. I just sent the organizers a note asking if there was anyway to add Backdrop CMS to the list of projects involved.
Ah, okay. I wasn't finding anything in searching the Internet. I now remember that being discussed in a past meeting.
Thanks.

We got a reply from CMSPhilly and they are interested in potentially including Backdrop CMS in a significant way in their event. They are in need of sessions right now and wondering how many people we might recruit to submit sessions.

Who would be interested and willing to submit a session?
https://cmsphilly.org/
i put in for a for a lando and headless/vue.js cms philly session; let me know if i can do anything w/ regards to backdrop participation

Can we claim credit for inspiring your submission or were you way ahead of us?

;-)
credit is all yours; i was not awares of cmsphilly at all until it came up here
@StPaulTim ++
stpaultim :-) (Karma: 16)
@Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) ++ for submitting
(serundeputy)** :pancakes: (Karma: 8)
mmm ... pancakes; :pancakes:

Who else would be interested in doing a virtual Backdrop session for CMSPhilly?
https://cmsphilly.org/

I'm offering to do it if nobody else volunteers ...my only issue at the moment is that my MacBook is behaving oddly with anything that has to do with streaming video ...the internet connection is being reset for some reason :shrug:
I just submitted a session titled "Backdrop CMS: a LTS version of D7 on steroids (a.k.a. everything you wanted from D7 w/o the D8 overhead)"

I plan to submit at least 1-2 sessions today. Anyone else interested?

Does anyone want to collaborate or strategize on what to offer. This could be great opportunity to showcase in Backdrop CMS at a non-Drupal virtual event.
Deadline is today.
I take that back. It looks like they extended the deadline to April 12th. If anyone else is willing to present, I'd be happy to coordinate or help generate topics.
NOTE: It's not clear from their website, but they are interested in Backdrop CMS specific topics. We are in touch with organizers.
I'd like to come up with a topic that showcases Backdrop CMS, but would also be of interest to a Wordpress user.
i could do the lando + drupal + vue.js w/ lando + backdrop + vue.js ... provided that it gets accepted;
but part of the point there is anyone of the elements can be switched out
@klonos submitted https://cmsphilly.org/talks/backdrop-cms-lts-version-d7-steroids-aka-everything-you-wanted-d7-wo-d8-overhead
@StPaulTim I'm around today but have some urgent tickets I need to get done...

@jenlampton and I were just brainstorming session ideas for CMSPhilly.org. Would anyone be interested in doing a high level presentation on "Theming in Backdrop CMS. " We were thinking something very high level that possibly describes how theming in BD is different from Drupal (or Wordpress) and potentially showcases some Backdrop themes that you have worked on

This would not need to be a nuts and bolds "how to" session. If I did this, I might focus on how I would describe the theming process to a Wordpress developer, while showing them some examples and talking about how I accomplished my specific goals for specific projects.

If there is anyone in our community that is interested in presenting, but has never done it before, this might be a good opportunity. No travel expenses and you can present from the comfort of your own home. :-)

I do a lot of theming, but sometimes have my own way of solving problems;-)... plus, I do not use the base themes. I spoke at several Drupal Camps, but not sure if theming session from me would be a good thing or not. Let me think about it....
And I have never built any actual site (weird huh? :sweat_smile: ) ...so not doing a lot of theming.
@klonos you should build a site :smiling_devil:

Yeah, I think so too. ...my official job title is "Drupal/GovCMS Support Engineer", so I help troubleshoot and solve any sort of Drupal issue (including theme issues) on existing sites, but I was never assigned any site-building project from scratch :sweat_smile:
build a personal site; just to go through it;
Oh, I've done that ...doesn't really count though :sweat_smile:
...people find it really hard to understand why I'm contributing to Backdrop as much as I do, when I'm not using it to build any actual sites.
i don't see why that doesn't count;
They were silly, couple-of-pages sites ...well + one site my brother and I used to use as an invoicing/inventory/CRM app.
...that second one was quite complex. Perhaps that one counts.
...but that was using Bartic, so still no theming :sweat_smile:
CMSPhilly is still accepting new talks. Which is good, because I forgot to submit mine. :-)
https://cmsphilly.org/
Are you local to Philly? This would be exciting news if we were able to leave our houses.

Hi, Jeff Porten. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU
https://cmsphilly.org is all remote this year
@Jeff Porten - Nope. I'm from Minnesota. Just helping recruit speakers for CMSPhilly.

@Jeff Porten I'm originally from Greece, but spend 80-90% of the year in Melbourne, Australia. Currently back in Greece with my family due to the whole COVID crisis ...my session was accepted, so I will be presenting.
@StPaulTim did you also submit a session perhaps? ...anyone else? ...will you be able to attend/help?

(time to revisit those slides at https://github.com/backdrop-ops/slides :slight_smile: )

backdrop-ops/slides
Presentation decks, for the common good. Contribute to backdrop-ops/slides development by creating an account on GitHub.

klonos said:

StPaulTim did you also submit a session perhaps? ...anyone else? ...will you be able to attend/help?

I did submit a session on layouts in Backdrop CMS and it has been accepted.
I see "The hidden power of Layouts in Backdrop CMS" listed as accepted :wink:
...I was planning to include that, but perhaps I can mention a "teaser" and leave the in-depth presentation on Layouts to you then.
@jenlampton @Tim (test) Erickson would you guys be interested in a short call at some point in order to align and share thoughts on the how's and what's for our CMSPhilly presentations?
@klonos - I'm available for that.
But not right now.
:+1:
...would that be now(ish), or do you wanna set a day/time to do it?
...you beat me to it :sweat_smile: ...just post a comment here to let me know what works best for you.
So I bought a ticket for this tomorrow but now I've been assigned to help with virus relief in the middle of the day. Are they recording the sessions?
i believe they are; i know @kevintull is going so i think they'll be on drupal.tv

@jenlampton @Geoff St. Pierre (serundeputy) @StPaulTim ...I just saw that there's an option to have co-presenters, so happy to help by answering questions coming from attendees (typed in the Q/A section) while you guys focus on your presentation.
Hey, look at this...a Zulip channel for CMS Philly I haven't read yet! :grinning:
(I'm sitting here with all the other @klonos groupies trying to get a spot at the rail.)
Just finished updating https://backdropcms.org/roadmap and https://backdropcms.org/user-guide/project-history since we (I?) missed to do that after the 1.15.0 release back in Jan :sweat_smile:
Holy cow, @klonos :...are you WORKING 5 minutes before your presentation?
^^^ planning to showcase b.org as the place where people can find info/resources about Backdrop CMS.
(I'll open up the backdoor and give my friends backstage passes, as groupies do: http://www.joinwebinar.com/ Webinar ID: 472-673-851 )
I hope your sessions do better than mine guys ...my daughter and her friends came and were being loud outside, so I was distracted :disappointed:

Justin Keiser said:

So I bought a ticket for this tomorrow but now I've been assigned to help with virus relief in the middle of the day. Are they recording the sessions?

Kevin Thull said in the Introductions channel of the CMSPhilly Slack chat that he was indeed recording the sessions and putting the recordings on drupal.tv.
Yep. Glad there are recordings. I hadnâ€™t joined the Slack yet to look last night.
It seemed fine, @klonos , though I sympathize with the trouble you were having. It looks like the presenter had to do a lot of work in terms of organizing the presentation, eh?

My main issue (other than being greatly distracted by kids/noise) was that I could not see the faces/list of participants, so there was no way to get a heartbeat/reading of the room ...I only figured out how to do that at the very end, and it was only you @Luke McCormick and @Laryn by then ...which explained why nobody had questions :sweat_smile:
...at some point I was so upset at my daughter for being loud/noisy that I started to forget my English :sweat:
I was in there for the second half of your presentation, and it felt weird that I could not tell at all if there was anyone else in the room.
Oh yeah, ...but I realize that that was because of privacy concerns :shrug:
Hmm. I'm not sure people are allowed the same amount of privacy when they're sitting in a room together.
Was there any way to tell how many people were out there?
It was saying 5 for me ...but I could see that because I was give presenter permissions I think; people with regular attendee permission might not have been able to.

klonos said:

It was saying 5 for me ...but I could see that because I was give presenter permissions I think; people with regular attendee permission might not have been able to.

correct;

I've been in a few sessions where there was very little feedback and I asked most of the questions (after pausing to make sure no one was speaking up). Not sure how well attended this is, but certainly there's been very little Q&A.
There were about 5 people in my session, but most of them people from this Slack channel there to support.
But, I didn't expect more. The value will be in the recordings that will be available in the future.
@Jeff Porten - Thanks for asking questions. It's so hard to do this kind of presentation when you are not getting any feedback. Your questions were appreciated.
@StPaulTim Thanks for that feedback, it's always a concern I'm not crowding out other people. The 1-on-1 format certainly worked in my favor! :-)

I dont' know if all the speakers feel the same way. But, it was a much better experience for me to have someone asking questions. I honestly don't think anyone else there had any questions, because most of them are smarter than me. :-)
Just learning Zulip and managed to react to the wrong comment with the wrong emoji....
@StPaulTim The guy giving the Custom Views talk just answered my concatenation question, assuming it's the same as Backdrop.
@Jeff Porten - Yes. Views is very much the same in Backdrop as Drupal. Did he suggest or demo "Views Rewrite" feature?
Yes, he showed the in-admin rewrite fields and now he's way over my head putting it into a module. :-)
I've never done it in code. I should probably watch his session!
He's very good, I'm coming back to him when it's on video and I can pause it.

@Jeff Porten - If you are interested in joining our Backdrop CMS class. We have weekly sessions on Tuesday at 4:00pm (Central). The sessions are mostly questions and answer with folks who are working on building their first Backdrop site. We do them on Zoom. It's free and open to anyone. We refer and use many of the screencasts that I have posted to the TeamTriplo Youtube channel.
Your questions would be welcome there.
@StPaulTim I will be there with bells on whenever I can. This sounds perfect. Will also be checking out your YouTube videos over the weekend. That was TeamTriplo channel?
YouTube - Team Triplo
If you want reminders about the class, sign up at https://simplo.site/
